Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in data analysis and a desire to grow their skills in SQL, Power BI, and equivalent technologies. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will work closely with subject matter experts in the team to analyze, and interpret data to support decision-making processes within the company.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Preparation: Gather data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. Clean and preprocess data for analysis.
Data Analysis: Use SQL to query databases, analyze data, and generate reports. Utilize Power BI for deeper insights and visualization.
Reporting: Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI to provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with different departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Data Visualization: Develop clear and visually appealing data visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and related technologies.


Preferred Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.


Technical Skills


SQL: Basic to intermediate proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL queries.
Power BI: Basic knowledge of creating and managing reports and dashboards.
Excel: Proficient in Excel for data analysis and reporting.
Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Communication: Good verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Team Player: Ability to work well in a team environment and collaborate with others.
Curiosity: A keen interest in data and a desire to continuously learn and improve.


Experience


0-2 years of experience in data analysis, internships, or relevant coursework.
Exposure to data analysis projects or tools in academic or professional settings is highly desirable.


Why Join Us?


Professional Growth: Opportunities for learning and development, including training in advanced data analysis tools and techniques.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a development-focused team of experienced analysts, software engineers and change managers.
Impact: Play a key role in driving data-driven decisions that influence the company‚Äôs strategy and operations.
Flexible Work Options: Potential for remote work or flexible hours based on performance.


How To Apply

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your interest in the role and how your skills align with our needs. Include any relevant projects or portfolio work that showcases your analytical skills.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]

üèùÔ∏èRecharge days

üåçOur office is located in Madrid.

‚åöFlexible work environment & hours.

üôåRegular team events.

üöóCabify staff free rides.

üöÄPersonal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

üìêCoursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

üí≥Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

üíªAll the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

üê±A pet room, so you don‚Äôt have to leave your furry friend at home

‚òïÔ∏èAnd last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!


WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.


KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market


YOUR CHALLENGE

  • You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
  • Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
  • You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
  • You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
  • You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
  • Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
  • You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
  • Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
  • During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!


YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

  • You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
  • You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
  • You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
  • You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
  • You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
  • You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
  • You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
  • You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
  • You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!


It would be a big plus if you

  • Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
  • Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders


SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

Title: Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you ‚Ä¶

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let‚Äôs talk about you:




Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet




As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you have a passion for technology and thrive on innovative and diverse projects, you've found your ideal destination. If you don't know us yet, we are a global technology provider that offers a complete portfolio of solutions in Payment, Mobile and Identity Solutions. With a rich history spanning 65 years of global experience, we have built a solid legacy that continues to grow. Comprising over 4,000 dedicated professionals across 16 countries, we collaboratively work towards creating a more trustworthy and secure world.




From our Trusted Connectivity vertical, we offer solutions for the Telecommunications market, such as SIM Cards, eSIMs, Subscription Management, iSE, to secure connectivity and guarantee interoperability, connecting people, companies, and objects efficiently and with secure processes.




We are actively seeking a passionate Data Analyst ready to embark on a journey of continuous learning and professional growth with us. This role will be based in Madrid with a Hybrid work model.




In this role you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the architecture and infrastructure necessary for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources.




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, a deep understanding of data pipelines, and proficiency in implementing scalable and efficient solutions and soft skills such as flexibility, communication and colaboration.




As a Data Analyst, you'll get to:




Key job responsibilities:




Data Architecture: Design, implement, and maintain scalable and robust data architecture to support the organization's data needs. Collaborate with analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.




ETL Development: Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL processes to ensure the efficient and accurate flow of data from source systems to data warehouses. Implement data cleansing, transformation, and enrichment techniques to ensure data quality and consistency.




Data Warehousing: Manage and optimize data warehouse structures for fast querying and reporting. Work with large datasets and implement strategies for partitioning, indexing, and optimizing query performance.




Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring seamless data flow and consistency. Implement real-time data integration solutions to support business needs.




Data Modeling: Design and implement data models that align with business requirements and support analytical processes. Ensure data models are scalable, flexible, and meet performance requirements.




Monitoring and Maintenance: Implement monitoring systems to proactively identify and address data pipeline issues. Perform regular maintenance, updates, and optimizations to enhance data pipeline performance.




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following:




Graduated in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Programming and/or Related Studies with Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
English Communication skills, both verbally and in writing is a must.
Strong knowldege of programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




What do we offer?




Join our team Valid by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Flexibility. We have flexible hours and possibilities of working from home to improve the work-life balance of our employees.
We care about your well-being. You will have private medical insurance
Do you need a break? You will find our cafeteria at your disposal




If you believe this opportunity is a good fit for you, please either apply through LinkedIn or send your application to: hrtalent@valid.com




Join this great team and be part of our story!




Valid creates an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to building a company that reflects the diversity of the world that means fighting for equal opportunities based on a responsible and inclusive management of its human team with actions as non-discrimination concerning sex, age, race, sexual orientation, religion, education, social status, culture, or special needs such as illness or disability.

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description:
IKONO is an innovative concept that is revolutionizing the leisure industry through the creation of unique, immersive experiences shaped by people across Europe.

IKONO is an immersive journey that combines art, play, and the unexpected where people are diving into eclectic worlds that invite them to self-discovery and shared experiences. Is a place to bring up the imagination and unleash free-form creativity while remaining in the city.

With six locations in Madrid, Rome, Barcelona, Budapest, Vienna, and Copenhagen, we are rapidly expanding, so you‚Äôll find IKONO in the heart of major cities across Europe (and beyond).

YOUR MISSION

As a Junior Data Analyst at IKONO, your mission is to build and maintain reliable data processes, ensuring data accuracy across all systems. You will analyze large datasets to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help identify key metrics, develop automated dashboards, and create impactful visualizations using PowerBI, simplifying complex data for non-technical stakeholders.

Your role will be key in empowering data-driven decisions across the organization while staying up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.

Your Responsibilities


Set up and maintain data processes and systems to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and KPIs.
Create data visualizations and reports using PowerBI to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the team in building dashboards and automating reporting processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.



YOU BRING


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical team members.
Resilient in handling daily challenges.
Demonstrate tremendous passion and energy for your work.



Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a startup/scaleup environment.
Experience with PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools (SQL, Python, etc.).



WE OFFER


A full-time + indefinite position in our Team.
Pleasant and International work environment, within a dynamic team.
Plenty of opportunities for development and personal growth.
Excellent work location at c/Alcal√°, in the touristic heart of Madrid.



What to expect in the hiring process?


An initial interview with our Recruitment team.
A technical interview with our Operations team.



At IKONO, we believe in fostering a collaborative, dynamic, and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected.

Our purpose: to unlock people's artistic playful side, empowering them to tap into their limitless creativity.

Our values: Ci penso io (I‚Äôll handle it), There‚Äôs always a way, Create with kindness, and Live your legend, it's all about initiative, optimism, empathy and collaboration, and fulfilling your potential within IKONO.

Apply now with your CV in English and join us in shaping unforgettable experiences and creating lasting memories together!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)

üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üèã Gympass

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst - Research
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with the global data teams

Data expert on investment data points, processes, methodologies, calculations & different fund structures

Manage business relationships with fund companies. Connecting with providers & setting up acquisition channels as well as acting as a point of escalation

Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients

Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.

Utilize project management methodologies such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.

Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.

Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution.

Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal partners to expedite issue resolution.

Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.

Skills:

A bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.

Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way.

Collaborate closely with the global data teams

Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance (f/m/d)
Description:
Purpose of Position

Awin‚Äôs Financial Analysts serve as a pivotal resource in shaping the company's financial future and strategic direction through expert data analysis and insightful financial modelling. This role enhances decision-making across the organisation by providing precise, data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to optimise performance and drive growth.

Key Tasks


Financial & Business Analytics Reporting: Develop and maintain reporting using Tableau to track key performance indicators, financial metrics, and other critical data points relevant to business operations
Financial Modelling: Create detailed financial models that forecast business performance and simulate various financial scenarios to aid in strategic planning and decision-making
Insight Generation: Analyse data and report outcomes to provide actionable insights that support business objectives and drive efficiency improvements
Stakeholder Communication: Present complex analysis and reports to stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner, ensuring that technical and non-technical audiences understand the implications and insights
Continuous Improvement: Continually refine and enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes using BI tools to better meet the company‚Äôs strategic needs.


Skills & Expertise


3+ years in a financial or business analytics position
Analytical, pro-active and inquisitive, with the ability to take ownership and deliver projects independently
The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to distil complex technical concepts into clear, concise explanations for non-technical audiences
Proficiency with SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau is essential
Fluency in English (C1+)


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Flexi-Office: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We‚ÄØoffer the flexibility to work wherever you want‚ÄØwithin our Awin locations.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We‚Äôve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.





Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us

Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you have a passion for technology and thrive on innovative and diverse projects, you've found your ideal destination. If you don't know us yet, we are a global technology provider that offers a complete portfolio of solutions in Payment, Mobile and Identity Solutions. With a rich history spanning 65 years of global experience, we have built a solid legacy that continues to grow. Comprising over 4,000 dedicated professionals across 16 countries, we collaboratively work towards creating a more trustworthy and secure world.




From our Trusted Connectivity vertical, we offer solutions for the Telecommunications market, such as SIM Cards, eSIMs, Subscription Management, iSE, to secure connectivity and guarantee interoperability, connecting people, companies, and objects efficiently and with secure processes.




We are actively seeking a passionate Data Analyst ready to embark on a journey of continuous learning and professional growth with us. This role will be based in Madrid with a Hybrid work model.




In this role you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the architecture and infrastructure necessary for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources.




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, a deep understanding of data pipelines, and proficiency in implementing scalable and efficient solutions and soft skills such as flexibility, communication and colaboration.




As a Data Analyst, you'll get to:




Key job responsibilities:




Data Architecture: Design, implement, and maintain scalable and robust data architecture to support the organization's data needs. Collaborate with analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.




ETL Development: Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL processes to ensure the efficient and accurate flow of data from source systems to data warehouses. Implement data cleansing, transformation, and enrichment techniques to ensure data quality and consistency.




Data Warehousing: Manage and optimize data warehouse structures for fast querying and reporting. Work with large datasets and implement strategies for partitioning, indexing, and optimizing query performance.




Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring seamless data flow and consistency. Implement real-time data integration solutions to support business needs.




Data Modeling: Design and implement data models that align with business requirements and support analytical processes. Ensure data models are scalable, flexible, and meet performance requirements.




Monitoring and Maintenance: Implement monitoring systems to proactively identify and address data pipeline issues. Perform regular maintenance, updates, and optimizations to enhance data pipeline performance.




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following:




Graduated in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Programming and/or Related Studies with Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
English Communication skills, both verbally and in writing is a must.
Strong knowldege of programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




What do we offer?




Join our team Valid by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Flexibility. We have flexible hours and possibilities of working from home to improve the work-life balance of our employees.
We care about your well-being. You will have private medical insurance
Do you need a break? You will find our cafeteria at your disposal




If you believe this opportunity is a good fit for you, please either apply through LinkedIn or send your application to: hrtalent@valid.com




Join this great team and be part of our story!




Valid creates an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to building a company that reflects the diversity of the world that means fighting for equal opportunities based on a responsible and inclusive management of its human team with actions as non-discrimination concerning sex, age, race, sexual orientation, religion, education, social status, culture, or special needs such as illness or disability.

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description:
IKONO is an innovative concept that is revolutionizing the leisure industry through the creation of unique, immersive experiences shaped by people across Europe.

IKONO is an immersive journey that combines art, play, and the unexpected where people are diving into eclectic worlds that invite them to self-discovery and shared experiences. Is a place to bring up the imagination and unleash free-form creativity while remaining in the city.

With six locations in Madrid, Rome, Barcelona, Budapest, Vienna, and Copenhagen, we are rapidly expanding, so you‚Äôll find IKONO in the heart of major cities across Europe (and beyond).

YOUR MISSION

As a Junior Data Analyst at IKONO, your mission is to build and maintain reliable data processes, ensuring data accuracy across all systems. You will analyze large datasets to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help identify key metrics, develop automated dashboards, and create impactful visualizations using PowerBI, simplifying complex data for non-technical stakeholders.

Your role will be key in empowering data-driven decisions across the organization while staying up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.

Your Responsibilities


Set up and maintain data processes and systems to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and KPIs.
Create data visualizations and reports using PowerBI to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the team in building dashboards and automating reporting processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.



YOU BRING


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical team members.
Resilient in handling daily challenges.
Demonstrate tremendous passion and energy for your work.



Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a startup/scaleup environment.
Experience with PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools (SQL, Python, etc.).



WE OFFER


A full-time + indefinite position in our Team.
Pleasant and International work environment, within a dynamic team.
Plenty of opportunities for development and personal growth.
Excellent work location at c/Alcal√°, in the touristic heart of Madrid.



What to expect in the hiring process?


An initial interview with our Recruitment team.
A technical interview with our Operations team.



At IKONO, we believe in fostering a collaborative, dynamic, and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected.

Our purpose: to unlock people's artistic playful side, empowering them to tap into their limitless creativity.

Our values: Ci penso io (I‚Äôll handle it), There‚Äôs always a way, Create with kindness, and Live your legend, it's all about initiative, optimism, empathy and collaboration, and fulfilling your potential within IKONO.

Apply now with your CV in English and join us in shaping unforgettable experiences and creating lasting memories together!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)

üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üèã Gympass

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission

üöÄ Join INETUM and be part of our innovative team! üöÄ

At INETUM, we are looking for skilled professionals for a challenging project. If you have experience as a DATA ANALYST, and can work remotely from Spain, this is your chance!

What are we looking for?

üéì Job Responsibilities / Role


Lead data model analysis initiatives, especially in the context of a data migration
Must be able to investigate and propose data mapping solutions to fulfil target data models
Key player on conversations with data Quality, data Owners and data Stewards, as well as Subject Matter Experts
Must be able to support test cycles to clarify doubts and resolve incidences
Progress reporting to senior management



Perfil

üìå Mandatory Skills


3yrs+ working experience as a Data Analyst
Experience in analysis and design of data collection systems
Track record of developing high quality analysis that has resulted in successful data model definitions and migrations.
Maintains internal and external relationships ensuring compliance in all activities.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team member.
Good communication and ability to use different influencing styles. Ability to tailor communication and leadership style to manage or influence colleagues.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.



üìå Nice To Have Qualities


Data modelling experience
Knowledge/experience with SQL for Hadoop/Big Data environments

üìå Qualities

Pragmatic and results-oriented

Able to receive and articulate constructive feedback
Adaptable to diverse set of technical responsibilities
Continuously learn and use their experience to come up with new ideas to solve problems

üìå Experience


4+ years



üéì Education


University degree in technology, preferably in computer science.



Why INETUM?

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.





Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us

Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Sector Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

We are focused on acquiring, cleaning, and analyzing large, unstructured data sets to generate new insights. Given the vast amount of data being produced, we are implementing new research methodologies to identify significant trends. We are committed to generating sustained alpha using a scientific approach to generate fundamental investment insights.




Job Description:

Coordinate with investment teams to understand their investment approach, and how data can support their research processes
Assist investment teams in understanding the key data drivers of companies and sectors
Analyze data from multiple sources to test complex investment theses
Quickly digest data, recognize inflection points, and determine data relevancy to the investment question at hand
Deliver high quality research to investment teams in a clear and digestible manner
Work with existing and new data sets to push significant ideas and decision support tools to investment teams




Required Attributes:

Intellectual curiosity with a genuine interest in investment
Professional demeanor, a capability to learn, think, and react quickly, along with exceptional communication and presentation skills as required for interaction with investment teams
Ability to consume sell side reports, understand fundamental investment theses & identify crucial data points
Creativity/ability to innovate, combined with a strong work ethic and organizational skills to efficiently handle demanding workload
Self-reliant and possessing good common sense
Comfort identifying, analyzing, and presenting novel data that is unique and useful




Required Skills:

Advanced knowledge of Python (including Pandas) and SQL
Strong background in statistical modelling
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Experience working with large, unstructured data sets




Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in statistics, engineering, economics, business, computer science, or physics
Advanced degree a plus, as are degrees spanning multiple disciplines
CFA or similar qualification a plus




Preferred:

Experience in the investment management industry
Proficiency with Excel and Bloomberg

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

--

Are you passionate about shaping the future of data ecosystems? We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the architecture of our cutting-edge data platform. At Material Bank, you'll play a pivotal role in building a modern data infrastructure utilizing advanced technologies like real-time data streams and machine learning-powered insights.

In this role, you'll integrate various data initiatives into a unified schema, establishing a single source of truth across the organization. Your expertise will be critical in defining universal schemas, rationalizing domain data and structures, and empowering our team to make data-driven decisions. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to both B2B and B2C products, impacting high-profile projects that will shape the future of Material Bank.

What you‚Äôll do:


Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.



What you‚Äôll bring:


3+ Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
Experience with data visualization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment



What you‚Äôll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We‚Äôll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a‚ÄØhybrid‚ÄØ working‚ÄØmodel allowing department leaders to decide on the‚ÄØbest approach for their respective teams, whether that be‚ÄØremote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world‚Äôs largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.
Show more
