Title: Data Specialist (Intern)
Description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.

Are you a trailblazer looking for a new challenge in a pioneering organization with global impact? Are you looking to boost your professional growth, being part of an emerging company? Then Eticas is for you!

At Eticas, we are global leaders in Responsible and Fair AI on a mission to protect people in technology processes. Over the last decade, we have developed cutting-edge methodologies and tools to identify and mitigate bias, promote fairness, and ensure AI and ML algorithms obtain more accurate results.

With our flagship AI Auditing product, ITACA, Eticas is at a crucial point in its history, and we need a winning team to execute this plan and assert ourselves as pioneers in deploying commercial auditing solutions.

What will your role look like?

As a Data Specialist Intern, you will support our AI auditing team performing sociotechnical analysis, reviewing and analyzing data, coding and contributing to the creation of audit reports, publications, and other audit-related content.

This internship provides a unique opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and motivated team and help shape a more ethical future in technology.

Your Key Responsibilities

Participate in building the scientific underpinnings of our groundbreaking tools to measure, monitor, and mitigate bias in AI.

Participate in the implementation of quantitative methods, including data collection, coding, developing metrics, and analysis of results.

Support our audits using both statistical tools and qualitative analysis methods to perform sociotechnical analysis which are applicable in real life.

Collaborate with team members to develop the existing products and create new ones based on the needs of the clients and market demand.

Managing project documentation and communicating with stakeholders and clients.

Stay updated on the latest developments in AI auditing and research to inform project activities.

Requirements

Must-have skills:

Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

Completed or in-progress degree in a relevant field such as social sciences (with a focus on quantitative methods), statistics, data science, computer science, or related disciplines.

Experience in R or similar coding tools (Python).

Solid understanding of statistics and experience with statistical analysis software.

Experience or interest in conducting research related to AI/ML, social media recommender systems, ethical technology, or algorithmic auditing.

Excellent written communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively as well as independently.

Enthusiasm for social change and a commitment to ethical considerations in technology.

Experience working in remote and cloud-based environments.

Experience in working in environments such as Agile, Scrum or similar methodologies.

A lifelong learning attitude.

Benefits

What Eticas can offer you:

We are pioneers of the sector in the world, so our day-to-day is never a routine. We embrace the challenge of learning every day how to improve in our roles and how to add value to others!

We work as a community, learning together from an emerging business. You will always count on us! We are diverse in technical and management profiles, whose motivation and knowledge we learn from every day.

We want to positively impact the world. You will work in a company that wants to generate global change, in pursuit of justice and responsibility.

We believe in independence in carrying out our tasks. We pursue our goals and insist on high standards.

We encourage and embrace diverse backgrounds because we understand the value of diversity to increase our value as a company.

Who will you be collaborating with?

Gemma, Founder and CEO at Eticas

Arancha Cienfuegos, Chief Operations Officer at Eticas

Ariane Aumaitre, Lead Data Scientist at Eticas

If, after everything we have explained, you think you are the best candidate, send an email to ****** with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in working with us and what you can contribute to Eticas and the above role.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the processes, data & tools of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage critical thinking skills to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.
Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies and processes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor or equivalent in Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting
4+ years of work experience with 2+ years in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment.
Technical and Proficient in data. Analyzing data sets with SQL queries, or crafting models and prototype tools, data is a core part of your toolkit.
Experience with BI tools and data visualization like Tableau, Power BI or Looker.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience in complex problem solving, and working in a fast paced environment.
Demonstrated ability in critical thinking and process optimization, with a proven track of identifying inefficiencies and implementing solutions to enhance business operations.
Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans.


Nice to have


Experience with Python or R is a strong plus.
Experience with forecasting and target setting, using data to establish future goals.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
Description:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

Position Overview

Dow Jones is looking for an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to join our B2C data team. You will possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and an understanding of digital analytics. You will leverage GA4 & other sources of marketing, web, & app data to create a cohesive set of reports and dashboards usable by a variety of stakeholders. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Utilize Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics across multiple digital marketing channels, including website traffic, user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates.
Ensure data quality. Prioritize and execute best practices to ensure data validation, integrity, and accuracy across various analytical tools and processes, including GA4, Adobe Analytics, and other data solutions.
Combine multiple data sources such as Google Campaign Manager, GA4 and others to provide holistic reporting and deeper insights into marketing programs.
Develop and maintain daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and build new dashboards or custom reports using GA4, or other approved data visualization tool leveraging BigQuery and our Data Lakes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of web & app data and marketing initiatives to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, across Marketing, Technology, and Product to support marketing and product initiatives with available data.
Work with technical teams to implement and manage data layer and data tags to meet marketing and analytics needs, ensuring they provide consistent and reliable data sources.
Assist our data engineering team in conjunction with our data teams to help classify our data architecture for use with various reporting and database tools.
Be a steward of our data governance and data privacy requirements; erring on validation with key stakeholders first to ensure accuracy of data is provided, reduce misinterpretation of data, and prevent misuse or dissemination of sensitive data.
Document and make transparent to stakeholders the data quality, sources, and methodology and requirements of projects delivered.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on how to effectively utilize GA4 and interpret marketing analytics data to drive business results.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital analytics and GA4, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Previous Experience in web/app analytics, with a focus on Google Analytics (GA4 experience preferred).
Proficient in SQL for data analysis, with a understanding of fundamentals, proficient in writing optimized queries, managing datasets, and leveraging advanced features for efficient data solutions.
Experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS), data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R, and data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.
Knowledge of Google Campaign Manager and Display & Video 360 (DV360) preferred
Experience with audience segmentation/management platforms (CDP, CRM, etc) preferred
Experience with digital marketing principles, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing.
Knowledge of tag management tools, such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager preferred.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Benefits

Comprehensive Medical Insurance Plans

Retirement Benefits

Sodexo Meal Vouchers

Fitness Reimbursement Program

\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 42409

Title: Data Analyst Team Lead
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.

Your tasks will include (but are not limited to):


Manage and develop a small team of Data Analysts covering EMEA analytical business needs, i.e. conducting ad-hoc analyses for Retailers & Brands to drive business growth and maximize performance by identifying root causes of ad performance issues, missed opportunities and areas of improvement (campaign optimization, inventory expansion, advanced marketing insights, etc.)
Set and assess team objectives, supporting personal development and helping everyone to be the best they can be.
Frequently interact with commercial teams and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights about their marketing efforts
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise to turn data into actionable insights (statistical thinking, A/B testing, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Proactively identify and implement processes, SLAs and tools improvement or optimization to maintain our Operational Excellence
Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from Commercial and Technical teams
Lead the team and technically assist them to design, develop and maintain self-service analytics tools used by the Retail Media organization, leveraging the full Criteo analytics stack and massive Hive and Vertica databases
Drive project delivery, continually reviewing personal and team results against our high standards, taking corrective action where needed to ensure success
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products, technologies, and position in the marketplace as they evolve



Who You Are:


You have management experience, preferably within an international context, and in a fast-growing technology driven environment
Project management skills ensuring that your team meets deliverables on time and according to identified business needs
Strong analytical skills: solid experience within Analytics and Data Science. Both SQL & Python are a must
You must have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
You have exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the big picture
A background in e-commerce or AdTech industry is a plus.
Fluency in English required



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst - Customer Lifecycle & Growth
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

As a key player, you‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with Product Managers, Marketing, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Develop and implement data frameworks to enhance our organic growth strategies, including SEO, CRM, and Referral programs
Drive virality and word-of-mouth growth by analyzing user behavior and helping teams capitalize opportunities where we have high user engagement
Generate strategic insights to shape top-level roadmaps.
Collaborate with teams to define KPIs for organic growth and maintain dashboards to monitor performance.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Examples of areas you will cover are:
Collect, organize and interpret, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques, trends, patterns, and correlations from large SEO data sets (internal and external data)
Analyze cross-channel data, particularly in SEO and SEM, to optimize marketing efficiency and prevent cannibalization.




What You Need To Succeed

3-5 years' experience in Data Science/Analysis, focusing on data analytics for business growth strategy;
Previous experience in fast-paced Technology or Management Consulting companies;
Proven ability to work with product teams, run experiments, and identify product optimization opportunities;
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics);
Proficient coding skills in SQL;
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.




Nice To Have

Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Braze) and referral programs;
Knowledge of SEO and third-party tools (e.g., Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Adwords);
Familiarity with predictive modeling;
Experience in digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake, and growth/retention analytics frameworks.




Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?!

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions offans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!




Here at Socialpoint, we are delighted to be looking for a Data Engineer Intern to join our Team.







Your quest will involve:




As a Data Engineer Intern you will help build the architecture that drives our business.

You will learn how to design Socialpoint‚Äôs Data Warehouse and ensure the highest level of data integrity and robustness. You will learn how to make all this data available to the different teams using cutting-edge visualization tools.




To achieve all of this, you will work closely with awesome developers and data scientists to make Socialpoint‚Äôs BI tools and architecture the best in the industry. You will learn to:




Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load data
Develop and optimize queries and scripts
Creation of automated data pipelines







To join our Guild you‚Äôll need:




An undergraduate degree in a quantitative field (computer science, statistics or math)
Scripting experience/knowledge in Python. Experience with other programming languages will also be considered.
Knowledge/experience in SQL. You can optimize a query for a specific database and understand the different capabilities of a given vendor DB.
You have a big interest in data and how it‚Äôs transformed into useful, actionable information
Excellent communication skills, know how to work in a team, prioritize and manage your own workload.
Fluency in written and spoken English.







And also, you should be:




Professional, passionate about data, proactive, team player, rigorous and detail oriented.
You have strong opinions on maintaining high quality work, can defend them and are open to receive and provide constructive feedback.
You work fast, quickly get up to speed with existing code and can adapt to fast changing situations.







What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?We work on a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

WFH monthly bonus
Breakfast and Lunch at the office
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam
T2 Discounts




Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:




State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).







Intrigued? We‚Äôd love to hear from you. Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.







Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in data analysis and a desire to grow their skills in SQL, Power BI, and equivalent technologies. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will work closely with subject matter experts in the team to analyze, and interpret data to support decision-making processes within the company.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Preparation: Gather data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. Clean and preprocess data for analysis.
Data Analysis: Use SQL to query databases, analyze data, and generate reports. Utilize Power BI for deeper insights and visualization.
Reporting: Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI to provide actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with different departments to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Data Visualization: Develop clear and visually appealing data visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and related technologies.


Preferred Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.


Technical Skills


SQL: Basic to intermediate proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL queries.
Power BI: Basic knowledge of creating and managing reports and dashboards.
Excel: Proficient in Excel for data analysis and reporting.
Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Communication: Good verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Team Player: Ability to work well in a team environment and collaborate with others.
Curiosity: A keen interest in data and a desire to continuously learn and improve.


Experience


0-2 years of experience in data analysis, internships, or relevant coursework.
Exposure to data analysis projects or tools in academic or professional settings is highly desirable.


Why Join Us?


Professional Growth: Opportunities for learning and development, including training in advanced data analysis tools and techniques.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a development-focused team of experienced analysts, software engineers and change managers.
Impact: Play a key role in driving data-driven decisions that influence the company‚Äôs strategy and operations.
Flexible Work Options: Potential for remote work or flexible hours based on performance.


How To Apply

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your interest in the role and how your skills align with our needs. Include any relevant projects or portfolio work that showcases your analytical skills.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

Show more
HTML:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:

  • Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
  • Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
  • Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
  • Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
  • Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
  • Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
  • Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
  • Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
  • Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.

Our Ideal Candidate Has

  • Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
  • At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
  • Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
  • Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
  • Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
  • Fluency in English and Spanish

Bonus Points

  • A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar

What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you have a passion for technology and thrive on innovative and diverse projects, you've found your ideal destination. If you don't know us yet, we are a global technology provider that offers a complete portfolio of solutions in Payment, Mobile and Identity Solutions. With a rich history spanning 65 years of global experience, we have built a solid legacy that continues to grow. Comprising over 4,000 dedicated professionals across 16 countries, we collaboratively work towards creating a more trustworthy and secure world.




From our Trusted Connectivity vertical, we offer solutions for the Telecommunications market, such as SIM Cards, eSIMs, Subscription Management, iSE, to secure connectivity and guarantee interoperability, connecting people, companies, and objects efficiently and with secure processes.




We are actively seeking a passionate Data Analyst ready to embark on a journey of continuous learning and professional growth with us. This role will be based in Madrid with a Hybrid work model.




In this role you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the architecture and infrastructure necessary for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources.




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, a deep understanding of data pipelines, and proficiency in implementing scalable and efficient solutions and soft skills such as flexibility, communication and colaboration.




As a Data Analyst, you'll get to:




Key job responsibilities:




Data Architecture: Design, implement, and maintain scalable and robust data architecture to support the organization's data needs. Collaborate with analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.




ETL Development: Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL processes to ensure the efficient and accurate flow of data from source systems to data warehouses. Implement data cleansing, transformation, and enrichment techniques to ensure data quality and consistency.




Data Warehousing: Manage and optimize data warehouse structures for fast querying and reporting. Work with large datasets and implement strategies for partitioning, indexing, and optimizing query performance.




Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring seamless data flow and consistency. Implement real-time data integration solutions to support business needs.




Data Modeling: Design and implement data models that align with business requirements and support analytical processes. Ensure data models are scalable, flexible, and meet performance requirements.




Monitoring and Maintenance: Implement monitoring systems to proactively identify and address data pipeline issues. Perform regular maintenance, updates, and optimizations to enhance data pipeline performance.




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following:




Graduated in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Programming and/or Related Studies with Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
English Communication skills, both verbally and in writing is a must.
Strong knowldege of programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




What do we offer?




Join our team Valid by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Flexibility. We have flexible hours and possibilities of working from home to improve the work-life balance of our employees.
We care about your well-being. You will have private medical insurance
Do you need a break? You will find our cafeteria at your disposal




If you believe this opportunity is a good fit for you, please either apply through LinkedIn or send your application to: hrtalent@valid.com




Join this great team and be part of our story!




Valid creates an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to building a company that reflects the diversity of the world that means fighting for equal opportunities based on a responsible and inclusive management of its human team with actions as non-discrimination concerning sex, age, race, sexual orientation, religion, education, social status, culture, or special needs such as illness or disability.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten

Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you ‚Ä¶

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let‚Äôs talk about you:




Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

S&P Ventilation Group is a market leading supplier in the field of ventilation solutions. After more than 70 years, the S&P group of companies are serving to more than 90 countries all over the world through different subsidiaries and distributors. The Group is currently employing more than 5.000 people.

S&P Group‚Äôs purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.




ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

The Business analytics department works closely with the different business teams in all related with data analysis, increasing our data accessibility, improving our data visualization, and enabling teams to address the different aspects of the business with more information and obtain better quality insights.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.




WORK-RESPONSABILITIES

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop of KPIs, reports and visualizations through Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Connect to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files, APIs) and transform data for analysis.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.




REQUIRED SKILLS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent English language skills.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Capitole Consulting keeps growing and we want to do it with you!




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data & Analytics Specialist.

The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in Power BI and user experience (UX) design, with a nice-to-have skill set in Power Apps.

This role will involve designing, developing, and maintaining data visualizations and dashboards that enhance our business intelligence capabilities while ensuring an optimal user experience.







Job main responsibilities:




Power BI Expertise:

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports.

‚Ä¢ Implement best practices for clear data visualization.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders to meet reporting needs.

‚Ä¢ Optimize Power BI solutions for performance.

User Experience (UX) Expertise:

‚Ä¢ Create intuitive interfaces using UX design principles.

‚Ä¢ Conduct user research and testing to improve usability.

‚Ä¢ Work with end-users to refine designs.




Power Apps (Nice to Have):

‚Ä¢ Develop custom applications and integrate them with Power BI.

‚Ä¢ Use Power Apps for workflow automation.




Data Engineer (Generalist):

‚Ä¢ Expertise in Azure Data Platform (Synapse, Data Lake, Databricks, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Experience with data integration from various sources.

‚Ä¢ Optimize solution performance and ensure compliance on Azure.

‚Ä¢ Provide technical leadership and mentorship.

‚Ä¢ Oversee AI model deployment and performance.

‚Ä¢ Manage data warehousing and real-time data streaming.

‚Ä¢ Ensure data quality, security, and privacy.







Work model: hybrid (Barcelona)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Years of experience needed ‚Äì 5+ Years

(At least 5 years‚Äô working experience in business analysis, project management skills being a plus)

Job Summary ‚Äì

You are interested in companies, customers and market behavior and methods to measure and anticipate it. Moreover:
You are a data driven person, with a passion to identify patterns in the data, identify the root causes, and suggest solutions from complex datasets.
You are passionate about coding, simplifying the complexity, automation and making processes more efficient.
You are keen on building and maintaining contacts with users/ clients, data scientists, and project managers and provide advanced analytics recommendations.
You are never satisfied until a problem is solved.




Technical Skills:

Collaborate with technical teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability for analysis.
Conduct data analysis to gain insights into business processes, performance, and trends.
Identify opportunities to automate data analyses and streamline reporting.
Leverage data science software like Python as well as analytics/visualization tools like Excel, PowerBI and Tableau to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Determine the most effective ways to visualize data, ensuring clarity and actionable insights.
Present the results and recommendations to the project team and contribute to the action plan for improvements.
Be in contact with users, assess their feedback and propose path forwards on how to improve the possible solutions.
Work independently, taking ownership of deliverables and driving them to successful completion

Experience required includes:

Experience in deploying ML and data science solutions.
Project management certifications: PMI, Agile




Qualification

Must be, at least, intermediate in Python.
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and Powerbi.
Excellent analytical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to think creatively and suggest original solutions to business.
Strong verbal and written communication/presentation skills.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business, Economics or any relevant field;
English proficiency

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description:
IKONO is an innovative concept that is revolutionizing the leisure industry through the creation of unique, immersive experiences shaped by people across Europe.

IKONO is an immersive journey that combines art, play, and the unexpected where people are diving into eclectic worlds that invite them to self-discovery and shared experiences. Is a place to bring up the imagination and unleash free-form creativity while remaining in the city.

With six locations in Madrid, Rome, Barcelona, Budapest, Vienna, and Copenhagen, we are rapidly expanding, so you‚Äôll find IKONO in the heart of major cities across Europe (and beyond).

YOUR MISSION

As a Junior Data Analyst at IKONO, your mission is to build and maintain reliable data processes, ensuring data accuracy across all systems. You will analyze large datasets to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help identify key metrics, develop automated dashboards, and create impactful visualizations using PowerBI, simplifying complex data for non-technical stakeholders.

Your role will be key in empowering data-driven decisions across the organization while staying up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.

Your Responsibilities


Set up and maintain data processes and systems to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and KPIs.
Create data visualizations and reports using PowerBI to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the team in building dashboards and automating reporting processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.



YOU BRING


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical team members.
Resilient in handling daily challenges.
Demonstrate tremendous passion and energy for your work.



Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a startup/scaleup environment.
Experience with PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools (SQL, Python, etc.).



WE OFFER


A full-time + indefinite position in our Team.
Pleasant and International work environment, within a dynamic team.
Plenty of opportunities for development and personal growth.
Excellent work location at c/Alcal√°, in the touristic heart of Madrid.



What to expect in the hiring process?


An initial interview with our Recruitment team.
A technical interview with our Operations team.



At IKONO, we believe in fostering a collaborative, dynamic, and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and respected.

HTML:
IKONO is an innovative concept that is revolutionizing the leisure industry through the creation of unique, immersive experiences shaped by people across Europe.

IKONO is an immersive journey that combines art, play, and the unexpected where people are diving into eclectic worlds that invite them to self-discovery and shared experiences. Is a place to bring up the imagination and unleash free-form creativity while remaining in the city.

With six locations in Madrid, Rome, Barcelona, Budapest, Vienna, and Copenhagen, we are rapidly expanding, so you‚Äôll find IKONO in the heart of major cities across Europe (and beyond).

YOUR MISSION

As a Junior Data Analyst at IKONO, your mission is to build and maintain reliable data processes, ensuring data accuracy across all systems. You will analyze large datasets to uncover actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help identify key metrics, develop automated dashboards, and create impactful visualizations using PowerBI, simplifying complex data for non-technical stakeholders.

Your role will be key in empowering data-driven decisions across the organization while staying up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.

Your Responsibilities

  • Set up and maintain data processes and systems to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
  • Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support business decision-making.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and KPIs.
  • Create data visualizations and reports using PowerBI to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Support the team in building dashboards and automating reporting processes.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data and analytics.


YOU BRING

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical team members.
  • Resilient in handling daily challenges.
  • Demonstrate tremendous passion and energy for your work.


Requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a startup/scaleup environment.
  • Experience with PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.
  • Proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools (SQL, Python, etc.).


WE OFFER

  • A full-time + indefinite position in our Team.
  • Pleasant and International work environment, within a dynamic team.
  • Plenty of opportunities for development and personal growth.
  • Excellent work location at c/Alcal√°, in the touristic heart of Madrid.


What to expect in the hiring process?

  • An initial interview with our Recruitment team.
  • A technical interview with our Operations team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What Is Exoticca

Exoticca is a pioneering online travel agency that has revolutionized the conception, production, and e-commerce of long-distance dream trips. At the core of Exoticca's brand equity is the commitment to "creating life milestones." We believe in delivering best-value trips, exploring unique destinations, curating extraordinary travel experiences, and demonstrating genuine care for both our customers and the planet.

We are a professional, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.

What is our proposal?

Join our Data Insights Team, where you'll play a key role in leveraging data for decision-making across Exoticca. As our Data Analyst, your main responsibilities include:


Utilize SQL to extract and analyze data
Work with automation tools like DBT or Airflow
Develop and maintain dashboards, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide actionable insights
Collaborate with the Data team to maintain a relevant data structure
Manage multiple data sources and identify improvements in data tracking and reporting processes
Manage Web & App Analytics tools implementation such as Google Analytics



Requirements


3+ years of work experience as an Data Analyst
Experience with GA4, Adobe or similar
Experience with Excel, SQL, DBT
Experience with modern visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Extremely detail oriented and proactive
Ability to present complex things in an easily understandable way
Knowledge of GTM is nice to have
Fluent in English and Spanish



Benefits


Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience
Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, and private health insurance with Cobee
Hybrid work model. Offices in Barcelona
Permanent contract from the start
Travel packages at reduced prices!
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you
Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lesson, bi-anual company parties
And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapidly growing organization!


Join Exoticca and play a pivotal role in creating life milestones through unforgettable travel experiences! This is your opportunity to shape the future of a dynamic and innovative travel brand on a global scale.

Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.
