  • Experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).

Title: Finance Systems Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview‚ÄØ

We are a leading European online business services provider, dedicated to offering cutting-edge solutions to our diverse client base. With a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, we are committed to expanding our product offerings and enhancing our market presence. The company is experiencing extremely high levels of organic and growth via the acquisition of new businesses.

‚ÄØ Position Overview‚ÄØ

We are building a new Finance Excellence Center in Lisbon (Portugal) to provide a complete finance service to our business. The company is currently implementing a new ERP tool across the group (NetSuite) and processes to improve and automate our Finance operations.

We are seeking a Finance System Data Analyst to join our team to support the implementation of the new ERP System and integrate data from all of the companies billing, payroll and customer billing systems. The ideal candidate will have strong data analysis and data integration experience, ideally in an environment where the ERP System integrates with backend systems in an International Finance Organisation, Excellence Center or Shared Service Center setup. The ideal candidate has the experience to be able to work hands-on, contribute to the setup of new Center as well is highly motivated to contribute to Continues Process Improvements.

Key Responsibilities:‚ÄØ


Key contributor in the implementation of the new ERP System including the transition of existing businesses and the on-boarding of future acquisitions as required.
Data analysis and management of the finance system, with responsibilities including:
Maintenance of existing feeds from integration systems to the Finance ERP, including, billing and payroll systems
Data analysis, investigation and changes to existing data feeds / transformations to debug issues and/or implement enhancements
Data analysis and investigation of data feeds for new acquisitions, in order to understand the effort and timelines required to integrate these new systems
Data mapping, cleansing and transformation of data feeds for new acquisitions
One off data migration and setup of financial data for new acquisitions (incl. migration of opening balances, supplier data and other core financial information)
Administration and ownership of the data integration layer (using our chosen iPaaS software -Workato), including configuration, enhancement and ongoing maintenance
Capturing and managing a central backlog of ongoing data requirements and enhancements
Co-ordination with external technical development teams responsible for integrating systems, to agree data feed requirements, interfacing contracts, interfacing method (API ‚Ä¶etc) and testing and release of new features and bug fixes
Plan and execute testing of ongoing enhancements to data integration feeds and the data integration layer
Advise the business on practical ways to use of the solution to meet business needs

Provide first line support to the Core Finance members that are using our newly rolled out ERP System and connection with several Billing Platform and Data Warehouses, including trouble shooting user issues, resolving system errors, escalating complex issues to stakeholders and work with internal and external experts on this.
Collaborate with cross-functional team to gather requirements, resolves issue and improve the functionality of the systems., including the creation and updating of the overall Finance Systems Roadmap.
Develop and maintain system documentation.
Assist with special projects and process improvement projects as


Qualifications:‚ÄØ

Must haves:


Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science or Data Science
Min. 5-year hands on experience in implementing and maintaining data integration solutions in IT/Finance environment, ideally using a leading data integration iPaaS solution (Workato, Mulesoft, Boomi, Jiterbit)
Relevant experience and track record in an international Finance environment / Share Service Center setup.
Excellent communication skills for both Business and Technical subjects
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, with a proactive and entrepreneurial mindset.



Desired:


Fluent in at least one other European Language



Key requirements:‚ÄØ

What questions can we ask as pre-selection:


Shared Service Center or International Finance Experience
Hands-on experience and experience managing and implementing data integration solutions for a new Finance ERP system



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 2000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: Financial Master Data Analyst (M/F)
Description:
Essity Global Business Services (GBS) business unit is currently searching for a Financial Master Data Analyst. This position will be based in Lisbon, Portugal.

As we continuously grow and transform, so does our need for leaner processes, the right data and business insights. GBS is the service partner to the entire Essity organization, delivering services within Finance, Human Resources, Workspace and Master Data.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for people who embody our values, aren‚Äôt afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve our services and ourselves. If this is you, we‚Äôd love to talk.

This individual is part of a global remote team with team members and management located in different parts of Europe and Americas.

What You Will Do

The GBS Financial Master Data team is a global team within Master Data Services in GBS at Essity. The responsibilities of Financial Master Data team include creation and maintenance of different Finance objects like GL accounts, internal customers/vendors, cost centers, profit centers etc. Quality assurance of such master data is a key focus and many other processes within Essity are relying on good quality in these records.

As a GBS Financial Master Data Analyst you have contacts with many Essity colleagues around the globe.

To this small global team we are now looking for an additional Master Data Analyst. As Master Data Analyst you will also work closely together with the other process leaders in GBS Financial Services and other Finance colleagues.

More specifically, you will:


Communicate and support the Master Data vision including global harmonization and a single Master Data process.
Understand global Master Data policies and procedures and strive to be the process champion ensuring adherence to Financial Master Data processes.
Train and communicate with Essity‚Äôs business functions to ensure appropriate involvement and understanding of the global Financial Master Data set.
Coordinate testing activities in projects and in the run phase.
Monitoring and reviewing Financial Master Data flows ensuring appropriate quality and accuracy. Highlighting issues and recommending improvement activities
Respond to more complex, escalated enquiries from team members and developing problem solving guidelines etc. to improve problem resolution.
Proactively contribute to projects and initiatives, challenging the status quo
Actively perform mass upload Master Data in conjunction with the IT group
Development and calculation of KPI‚Äôs, ad hoc reporting and data analysis
Implement desired workflow tools or automation systems across all geographies, forging relationships with IT Architecture colleagues and ensure the promotion of Data Governance
Take part in our big strategic initiatives.


Who You Are

At Essity our ambition is to increase health and hygiene standards across the world. To do this we depend on motivated, competent and high-performing employees.

Apart from above, you have:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in relevant area
Three plus years of experience within Finance, specifically in Accounting
Proven proficiency with Excel
Experience in Financial Master Data is highly preferred
Experience with SAP, specifically having worked with MDG/S4Hana is highly preferred
Analytical mindset
Eager to learn and share
Holistic thinking
Fluent in English - All Applicants are requested to deliver their CV in English language.


What We Can Offer You

At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.

Collaborative and Caring Culture | Empowerment & Engaged People | Work with Impact and A Powerful Purpose | Individual Learning & Career Growth | Health & Safety Priority | Sustainable Value Together| Innovation| Sustainable Working Life | Total Reward

Together, we are improving lives, every day.

Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.

Application End Date:

12 set. 2024

Job Requisition ID:

Essity239468

Title: Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Lisbon




Introduction to role:

Join our Global Business Services (GBS) Data Assurance team at AstraZeneca, a place built on innovation and creativity. We are looking for a Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst who will play a crucial role in ensuring that our master, reference, and transactional data is fit for purpose. This role is pivotal in identifying, investigating, and resolving data issues affecting planning, reporting, and other Finance processes.




Accountabilities:

As a Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for investigating data quality issues, defining manual adjustments to temporarily correct time-critical issues, and working with users, data stewards, and operations teams to ensure fixes are applied correctly. You will also contribute to improvements in tools, methods, processes, documentation, and controls within the team. Your proactive, analytical, and investigative mindset will be key in using data quality reporting tools, system reconciliations, and direct data analysis to proactively identify potential data issues for resolution.




Essential Skills/Experience:

Experience of working with financial data and systems, preferably SAP FICO
Background in data analysis and issue investigation in a complex data and system environment
Experience in the maintenance and use of common financial data (e.g. costs centres, profit centres, chart of accounts, transactional postings)
Good understanding of financial processes
Good understanding of data quality and data management principles
Proactive, analytical and investigative mindset
Proficient in Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills




Desirable Skills/Experience:

Accounting background
Experience of working in a complex global organisation
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge
Experience using data quality profiling and monitoring tools
Experience in querying data using SQL
Experience creating reports
Experience supporting Finance month end processes, reporting and planning




When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That‚Äôs why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we‚Äôre not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.




At AstraZeneca, we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and challenge convention. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges. There is no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture where you will connect different thinking to generate new and valuable opportunities. Where you will find a commitment to lifelong learning, growth and development for all.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in our mission to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job


BNPP Global Markets Americas is looking to expand its team of dedicated data engineers in Portugal to support Prime Services, part of the Global Equities Global Business Line (GBL).
The team in Portugal works closely with Prime Services Prime Trading Americas. This team is focused on generating business analytics, building data pipelines, and projects implementation to better position the business for their current and future needs. A primary focus of the role is assisting in the improvement of funding efficiencies and meeting client demand through improved data availability and analysis, client insights, and ultimately through enhanced data and business processes. The ability to work with large amount of messy data and designing and then implementing improved data models will be important. A successful candidate should have strong communication skills, be a team player, have the ability to learn quickly, and focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment. The job will require interaction with Front Office, Technology, and Product Development.


Your Main Activities Are


The required position would support Equity Financing business in its reporting : creation / automation / monitoring (both the indicators produced and the fact that report is being produced)
Within the Support team, the individual will work closely with Front Office and Quant Research :
Monitor production of daily reports required by the business :
Trouble shot with IT in case of production issue
Data quality check day over day. Escalation to Operations (MO) and Front in case of booking issue
Improve automation of reports production
Work with Business and Quant to enhance existing reports with new data / method
Automate production from XL based template to server based production
Design new reports, and provide analysis and optimization suggestion
Work with business to enhance our reporting framework to display more relevant indicators
Once familiar with data, help in the analysis of the reports , highlight outsiders and suggest improvements
Ability to travel to New York for a period of up to 1 month for on-desk experience and training

Profile and Skills to Success


BA, BS or MS degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance or Economics)
1-4 years of relevant experience such as in Data Analytics or Engineering
Experience in Capital Markets or Investment Banking
Perfect fluency in English
Good communication skills
Proficiency in Python, SQL Excel and VBA
Quantitative, analytical and logical problem solving skill
Basic knowledge of financial markets and Prime Brokerage
Experience using Dev-ops tools such as GIT, Jira and APIs


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer (SDA)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Engineer for an national project in the banks sector.

üí° What We Are Looking For


Advanced knowledge of SQL systems with experience developing in Oracle environment
Advanced knowledge of SQL (Mandatory )
Professional experience with Python
Knowledge of Airflow
Experience with GIT (preferably bitbucket)
English ‚Äì Expert


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Reconciliation of professional and family life

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians customers, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject DE.RM.DB

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description



MISSION:


We are looking for an IT Business Analyst with experience in agile methodology to integrate one of our squads.


You will work from Lisbon (hybrid model) collaborating daily with a global team in a multi-country and multi-cultural environment."





Main Tasks:


Collect, analyze and prioritize business requirements, anticipating problems and evaluating impacts
Conduct workshops with relevant stakeholders, sponsors and/or teams to define the solution.
Analyze business requirements with a critical mindset and challenge them when needed.
Identify and specify the solution with squad and tribe architects.
Effectively breakdown business needs into requirements contained within a product backlog which can then be implemented in a series of short and iterative development cycles.
Clearly communicate those business needs to the development team by writing user stories and acceptance criteria.
Test user stories during development phase and contribute to increase test automation coverage.
Participate in the organization of user acceptance tests with the end users.
Write and update documentation with content adapted to target audience (Development, Product and Support teams) and deliver training sessions.

Technical Skills:


Minimum of 5 years experience as a business analyst working in a context of agile software development
Experience in translating business requirements into user stories, use cases and technical requirements.
Experience with Agile Scrum methodologies.
Working knowledge of software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, CM, quality assurance, and release management.
College degree (B.S.) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Management Systems or equivalent professional experience.
Experience in estimating techniques.
Experience analyzing data and data relationships across an organization‚Äôs business areas.









Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years experience as a business analyst working in a context of agile software development
Experience in translating business requirements into user stories, use cases and technical requirements.
Experience with Agile Scrum methodologies.
Working knowledge of software development life cycle, including planning, development, requirements management, CM, quality assurance, and release management.
College degree (B.S.) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Management Systems or equivalent professional experience.
Experience in estimating techniques.
Experience analyzing data and data relationships across an organization‚Äôs business areas.

Language Skills:


English ‚Äì Expert
French ‚Äì Expert (valued but not mandatory)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our Business

team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 40+ successful brands make up the group; within those brands, over 2000 experts serve its 2.5+ million customers across Europe and beyond. team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.

The Team

You will join the Data & Analytics team, offering a unique opportunity to become part of the central data unit within one of Europe's most ambitious and rapidly growing hosting companies, serving over 2.5 million customers. As a leader in our industry, we understand the crucial role Data Engineering plays in harnessing customer data to inform and drive our commercial strategy.

What you will bring: You are self-motivated, ambitious, and collaborative, capable of independently turning new ideas into actionable steps. You excel at communicating across all levels of the organization, translating technical jargon into business-friendly language, and converting business requests into technical solutions. This role requires you to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will thrive in this environment and have a proven track record in similar roles.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to ingest, process, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Implement efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure timely and accurate data delivery to downstream systems and applications.
Design and implement data models and schemas to support analytical and operational requirements, ensuring data integrity, consistency, and efficiency.
Manage and optimize database systems for performance, security, and scalability, including schema design, indexing, and query optimization.
Integrate data from various internal and external sources, including APIs, databases, and third-party systems, to enrich and enhance our data assets.
Understand or quickly learn business concepts in the domains of marketing, finance, PE, M&A and more.



Technical Skills Required


Advanced skills in SQL (TSQL, PgSQL, PLSQL) shell scripting (bash, PowerShell ) and python
Good knowledge of at least one database engine between: Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL
Experience in ETL/ELT development, frameworks and components ( SSIS, Power Query, Pandas, Airflow, cloud services)
Good knowledge of data warehouse modelling techniques (dimensional model, star schema, snowflake design)
Proficiency in analytical frameworks (Excel, R/Python).
Knowledge of Microsoft Master data and Analysis services
Flexibility to learn and adapt; strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.



Education And Work Experience


At least 3 years of relevant experience, working in business intelligence, ideally in a related industry
Advanced degree in Computer science, STEM subjects (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering, etc), or relevant work experience
Demonstrable track record in developing data intelligence solutions that are stable and high performing; provide business value; and use resources efficiently



About The Job

As a data engineer, you will develop and maintain the central data warehouse and help us take the most value out of our data and meet our increasing data needs. Your work assignments will centre around back-end development, focusing on building optimized data structures with best-in-class load performance. You will help us integrate newly acquired businesses into the central data warehouse, besides improving and expanding already existing structures to enable an even more data-driven approach. To this extent, your role will be crucial in supporting the Data & Analytics team in increasing the data available centrally and its fast, easy access for the end users. You will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that inform business strategies, improve customer processes, and drive overall performance. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a passion for uncovering trends and patterns within complex datasets. The central Data & Analytics team is one of the pillars of team.blue strategy, and the priorities and collaboration in the team are aligned daily with full involvement from team members and the management.

Right to work

At any stage please be prepared to provide proof of eligibility to work in the European country you are applying for.

Unfortunately, we are unable to support Sponsorship Visas.

"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 2000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue
Show more
HTML:
Our Business

team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 40+ successful brands make up the group; within those brands, over 2000 experts serve its 2.5+ million customers across Europe and beyond. team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.

The Team

You will join the Data & Analytics team, offering a unique opportunity to become part of the central data unit within one of Europe's most ambitious and rapidly growing hosting companies, serving over 2.5 million customers. As a leader in our industry, we understand the crucial role Data Engineering plays in harnessing customer data to inform and drive our commercial strategy.

What you will bring: You are self-motivated, ambitious, and collaborative, capable of independently turning new ideas into actionable steps. You excel at communicating across all levels of the organization, translating technical jargon into business-friendly language, and converting business requests into technical solutions. This role requires you to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will thrive in this environment and have a proven track record in similar roles.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to ingest, process, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources.
  • Implement efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure timely and accurate data delivery to downstream systems and applications.
  • Design and implement data models and schemas to support analytical and operational requirements, ensuring data integrity, consistency, and efficiency.
  • Manage and optimize database systems for performance, security, and scalability, including schema design, indexing, and query optimization.
  • Integrate data from various internal and external sources, including APIs, databases, and third-party systems, to enrich and enhance our data assets.
  • Understand or quickly learn business concepts in the domains of marketing, finance, PE, M&A and more.


Technical Skills Required

  • Advanced skills in SQL (TSQL, PgSQL, PLSQL) shell scripting (bash, PowerShell ) and python
  • Good knowledge of at least one database engine between: Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL
  • Experience in ETL/ELT development, frameworks and components ( SSIS, Power Query, Pandas, Airflow, cloud services)
  • Good knowledge of data warehouse modelling techniques (dimensional model, star schema, snowflake design)
  • Proficiency in analytical frameworks (Excel, R/Python).
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Master data and Analysis services
  • Flexibility to learn and adapt; strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.


Education And Work Experience

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience, working in business intelligence, ideally in a related industry
  • Advanced degree in Computer science, STEM subjects (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering, etc), or relevant work experience
  • Demonstrable track record in developing data intelligence solutions that are stable and high performing; provide business value; and use resources efficiently


About The Job

As a data engineer, you will develop and maintain the central data warehouse and help us take the most value out of our data and meet our increasing data needs. Your work assignments will centre around back-end development, focusing on building optimized data structures with best-in-class load performance. You will help us integrate newly acquired businesses into the central data warehouse, besides improving and expanding already existing structures to enable an even more data-driven approach. To this extent, your role will be crucial in supporting the Data & Analytics team in increasing the data available centrally and its fast, easy access for the end users. You will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that inform business strategies, improve customer processes, and drive overall performance. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a passion for uncovering trends and patterns within complex datasets. The central Data & Analytics team is one of the pillars of team.blue strategy, and the priorities and collaboration in the team are aligned daily with full involvement from team members and the management.

Right to work

At any stage please be prepared to provide proof of eligibility to work in the European country you are applying for.

Unfortunately, we are unable to support Sponsorship Visas.

"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 2000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Are you a skilled data engineer, passionate about building data products?

We're seeking a talented individual to join our data team to be part of the foundation for SoSafe's data-driven future, in one of Europe‚Äôs most successful cyber security startups. You'll play a pivotal role in shaping our data infrastructure and transforming raw data into actionable insights that power our product and drive business growth.

Your mission



Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and infrastructure to support our rapid business growth.
Collaborate closely with product, analytics, and other teams to deliver data-driven solutions that power our product roadmap and enhance customer experiences.
Take ownership of the data infrastructure, driving best practices and ensuring data reliability and performance.
Democratize data access by building scalable and secure data delivery mechanisms.
Ensure data pipeline reliability through robust monitoring, alerting, and CI/CD practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data engineering, evaluating new technologies and frameworks to enhance our data capabilities.
Actively participate in technical discussions, code reviews, and decision-making processes.
Effectively manage stakeholder expectations and communicate technical concepts clearly.



Your profile



3+ years of experience building and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines using cloud technologies (AWS is preferred)
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL and data engineering tools (e.g Airflow, dbt)
Expertise in data warehousing, data modelling, and ETL/ELT processes
Demonstrated experience with DevOps practices, including infrastructure as code (Terraform) and CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions).
Excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build strong working relationships with colleagues.
Strong analytical thinking skills and a solution-oriented mindset.
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, with a passion for continuous learning and adaptability to evolving challenges. Proactive self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Fluent in English and optionally German.
Bonus points: Experience with CDC tools.



Why Us?‚ÄØ

At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact, surrounded by a dynamic and supportive team and environment committed to your professional growth.‚ÄØ

What we offer:‚ÄØ



Work-Life Balance:‚ÄØ
Flexible hours‚ÄØ
33 vacation days‚ÄØ
Work Environment:‚ÄØ
State-of-the-art tech‚ÄØ
Annual company off-site‚ÄØ
Networking events‚ÄØ
Healthcare:‚ÄØ
OpenUp‚ÄØ
Other Perks:‚ÄØ
Referral Bonus‚ÄØ
Learning & Development Allowance‚ÄØ



About Us

We are one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide. By putting people first and focusing on behavioral science, we are disrupting the status-quo of Cyber Security.

Backed by strong VC funding by those such as Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we are looking for more motivated team players who will assist us with our ambitious mission and international expansion. At SoSafe, you will take ownership for your work and your growth, taking your career to the next level! If you want to have an impact and are looking to contribute in meaningful ways within an open-minded environment that values diversity and community, SoSafe might just be the right place to work for you!

Are you our next Cyber Security Hero?

Come work with us in our HQ in Cologne, our offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris or Lisbon or at our co-working locations in Dublin, Munich, London or Chemnitz.

Join us on our journey to make the digital world a safer place!

Title: FVL Monitoring Data Analyst
HTML:
• Join a high reputable multinational company - Global Business Services|Customer Order - Invoicing - Excel - SAP - French Speaker

About Our Client

Our client is a worldwide expert in supply chain solutions and the European leader in automotive logistics.

Responsabilities

Job Description

  • Share the weekly schedule and update it following changes or cancellations;
  • Check the integration of customers' Transport orders in our systems and make claims when needed;
  • Make corrections in systems;
  • Establish reports to monitor the status of customers' Transport orders;
  • Keep the Rail Operations and Control Tower departments informed of the situation;
  • Share information or disfunctions needed to be reported to the hierarchy;
  • Manage the correct follow-up of the customers' Transport orders;
  • Search and choose the most appropriate solutions to problems encountered;
  • Forwarding customer complaints to the respective Subsidiaries.

The Successful Applicant

Skills & Experience

  • High School Education or Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance;
  • Minimum 2 years experience in identical role;
  • Advanced Knowledge of Excel and SAP;
  • Mastery to work with sharepoint files;
  • Languages: Fluent in English (Minimum C1), French (Minimum B2)

What's On Offer

  • Hybrid working model (4 days at the office, 1 day Home Office)
  • A good opportunity for your professional growth.

Contact: Alexis Da Silva

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6514204

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Commercial Intelligence Team within the Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence department (RMCE) is looking for a motivated and driven Data Engineer (m/f/d) who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Who We Are

The Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence (RMCE) department combines commercial responsibilities with strategic pricing and the monitoring, analysis and interpretation of KPIs to optimize revenue. As an open and interconnected hub within the commercial organization, RMCE fosters transparency, collaboration, and synergy across all functions.

The Commercial Intelligence team owns the RMCE's department‚Äôs analytical products: from data pipelines, reports, and ad-hoc analyses to tools and applications. We support the department and the whole company in taking data-driven business decisions by translating big data into actionable insights and building automated solutions. Our long-term goal is to enhance our Revenue Management System with integrated solutions (reports, tools, UIs) that would replace our current product portfolio. To this end, our team is looking for someone with both data modeling and engineering knowledge to drive our offer to the next level.

Your Tasks ‚Äì Paint the world green

As a Data Engineer you will work on a wide range of interesting tasks to actively support the business teams in optimizing revenue, ensuring profitability, and fostering sustainable growth.

This is a highly visible role that requires rigor, self-organization, autonomy, hands-on mentality and entrepreneurial spirit, and will give you the opportunity to develop many transversal skills (engineering, data modeling, analytical, commercial, project and stakeholder management, amongst others).

You Will


Build automated data pipelines with the use of SQL, Python and workflow orchestration tools
Together with the team, you design, implement and optimize your teams services & products
Embrace modern DevOps and Backend Software engineering practices
Transform, test and document data
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, understand business requirements, and present findings to non-technical stakeholders


Our Tech Stack


Python
Snowflake
DBT
Jenkins and GitLab CI/CD
AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
Kafka
Power BI


Your Profile ‚Äì Ready to hop on board


At least 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Fluency in Python
Good SQL knowledge (in connection to Snowflake)
Experience working with workflow orchestration tools (Airflow)
Experience with DevOps and Infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab - CI/CD pipelines, Terraform)
Some experience with cloud providers, particularly AWS
You are familiar with Kafka
Preference for working along Agile frameworks
Experience collaborating with Data Teams
You possess understanding of analytics engineering tools such as DBT or similar
Knowledge of monitoring (DataDog) and data modeling (Power BI) tools is a plus
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


Our Perks ‚Äì More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule, and balance work between the office and home as it‚Äôs best for you. We give you trust-based hours and a flexible smart working policy.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We‚Äôre building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: SQL Server Developer
HTML:
Finsolutia is a modern, dynamic and robust Fintech, specialized in the credit area, with more than 300 employees at Iberian level.

We have a challenging and ambitious professional project for a SQL Server Associate, with the opportunity to develop technical and personal skills, knowledge and above all grow.

The Profile We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Hard skills:
    • Proven 2+ years of experience as an SQL Developer and ETL Processes;
    • Excellent understanding of T-SQL programming, Microsoft SQL Server;
    • Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices;
    • The Software Development Life Cycle (specifically Scrum) and the Agile methodology;
    • Fluent in English.
  • Soft Skills:
    • Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
    • Team work and result oriented;
    • Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.
Nice To Have

  • Experience in ETL processes with SSIS and Console Applications (C#);
  • Effective Experience with SQL Server 2019 and In-Memory;
  • Query Optimization (SPs, Views, Functions, Dynamic Sql, ‚Ä¶) using DMVs and advance optimization tools;
  • Knowledge and experience in Data Security and Data Protection.

The Day-to-day Of This Position

  • Develop high-quality SQL Server database solutions;
  • Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
  • Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications;
  • Designing database tables and related objects;
  • Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
  • Developing scripts and procedures for application development;
  • Implement ETL Processes;
  • Research required data;
  • Suggest new queries.

What We Offer

  • We are Competitive | Attractive remuneration and benefits package;
  • Welcome kit | On your first day you'll have all the material you need to start your journey with us;
  • Your success is ours | You'll have initial (on-job) and ongoing training;
  • We care about you | We offer you health and life insurance, curative medicine and an annual vaccination program;
  • We care about the world | Throughout the year we develop various corporate responsibility activities in which you can participate and even help organize;
  • We are fans of accountability and commitment | We flex work but we hold everyone accountable for the results and work done;
  • We are all different | We provide a benefits platform;
  • We work hard, yet we promote a fun work environment | We have several corporate events that are true moments of sharing and fun;
  • Extra days | Your birthday is meant to be spent with family and friends;
  • They say that the most important meal of the day is breakfast | Have it with us every day at the office;
  • Several discounts and advantages | By being part of our team you'll have access to several discounts and protocols.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Lead Data Engineer (f/w/d), you will build and guide your team of Data Engineers who are responsible for enabling technically translated business requirements into analytical products, helping to bring new insights alive. As a leader, you will be at the forefront of our transformation journey to become a data driven company in future.

Passionate about the environment and climate change? Ready to be part of the future of the energy transition? The Siemens Energy Data Analytics & AI team plays a significant role in driving the energy transformation.

Honestly, we don‚Äôt have all the answers. Honestly, given the scale of the challenge we need many types of perspectives to help reimagine the future. And honestly, we can‚Äôt do it alone.

Our team is looking for innovative, enthusiastic, and versatile data, digital, and AI professionals that will drive us forward on this exciting venture.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You

Your profile


Extensive experience leading data architectures and data-related initiatives, as well as leading a data operations team
In-depth understanding and knowledge of data acquisition, data modeling and analytics
Extensive experience in data & analytics and data architecture and at least 3 years of experience as a team leader
Extensive and in-depth knowledge of database and data warehouse modeling
Experience developing streaming and batch data pipelines for cloud and hybrid infrastructures
Experience with streaming frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT stack) and hands-on experience with modern software development tools
Extensive experience in data analytics and the ability to slice and dice data as needed
Experience with cloud providers in data architecture (e.g. AWS)
Knowledge of data warehouses that support analytical workloads
Extensive and in-depth experience working with ETL



Your Responsibilities


Lead a team of data engineers focused on leveraging data and information across the SE to improve data-related operations and gain risk-related insights
Drive technical implementation and accountability for strategy and execution
Determine the scope of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for upcoming initiatives and outline the future roadmap for enhancements and potential improvements
Collaborate with data owners on planning and execution of key initiatives
Oversee the performance and quality of integration pipelines created in close collaboration with the data integration team
Drive architecture design and discussions with guidance from the teams
Promote data literacy towards visualization through self-service capabilities for end users
Advocate for modern software development methodologies and champion Scrum and SAFe
Conduct code reviews and ensure teams adhere to appropriate standards
Document and present methods, procedures, and project deliverables to senior stakeholders in various functions



Let‚Äôs Talk About Us

"Let‚Äôs make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

In our Business Functions we enable our organization to reach their targets by providing best-in class services and solutions in the areas of IT, HR, Finance, Real Estate, Strategy & Technology and more.

Check out this video to see what we do here! https://bit.ly/3IfnlaR

The Data & Analytics organization has been established and designed to help Siemens Energy achieve our mission by becoming a data driven organization. Treating and using data as a strategic asset enables us to support customers in transitioning to a more sustainable world, by using innovative technologies and bringing ideas into reality.

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

Title: Quantitative Backtesting Analyst
Description:
Mission

Develop and maintain the Model Performance Assessment methodology of internal rating models on the Basel credit risk parameters (PD, LGD, EAD / CCF), or contribute to other studies and projects within team's responsibility.

Responsibilities

‚ñ™ Contribute to the production of backtesting on risk parameters by producing the different steps: Data collection, Database construction, Back testing production, Report preparation.

‚ñ™ Contribute to the production of the backtesting ECB Templates.

‚ñ™ Contribute to the production of the backtesting Shortcuts.

‚ñ™ Participation in transversal projects related to credit risk models performance assessment.

‚ñ™ Control and validation of LGD spreadsheet.

‚ñ™ Improvement of existing tools and processes.

‚ñ™ Ensure a robust permanent control framework to deliver in a timely manner, reliable and consistent backtesting.

Requirements


Ability to collaborate
Ability to deliver
Ability to develop and adapt
Analytical Ability
Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
Risk Management - Risk analysis
English (Fluent)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS SAS (Proficient)
IT PROGRAMS CONCEPTION (Proficient)
Risk and Controls ([0 - 2] years)
Masters in Mathematics and Statistics

Title: Data Engineer Senior (With Teradata and French)
Description:
Job Description



We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer with expertise in Teradata to join our team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building Datalab and Datamart solutions using Teradata technology. Your responsibilities will include the development of data collection solutions, storage, processing, and provisioning for analytical and management tools.


Key Responsibilities


Data Solutions Development: Contribute to the construction of Datalab and Datamart solutions using Teradata.
Data Collection and Processing: Develop data collection solutions, manage data storage, process aggregates or scores, and ensure data availability.
Modeling and Development: Utilize Teradata BTEQ for data modeling and development, including creating views for analytical and management tools (e.g., MSBI, Qlik Sense).
Project and RUN Activities: Work on both project-related tasks and ongoing operations, including production processing, incident resolution, optimizations, and continuous improvement.


Qualifications



Required Skills


Teradata Expertise: Strong experience with Teradata technology, including BTEQ and TPT.
SQL & Relational DBMS: Proficiency in SQL and relational database management systems, particularly Teradata.
UNIX Environment: Experience with UNIX environments, including directory usage and warehouse management.
ETL & Data Warehousing: Experience with warehouse loading modes (ETL) using BTEQ.
Control-M: Proficient in using CONTROL-M for job scheduling and management.
DevOps & Documentation: Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools like GIT, Jira, Confluence, MEGA, and Zeenea.

Qualifications


Language: Fluency or Professional working in French is required.
Experience: Proven experience in data engineering with a strong focus on Teradata technology.
Team Collaboration: Strong collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively within a team.
Must be in Portugal, Lisbon


Additional Information



If you are passionate about data engineering and have the skills and experience we're looking for, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of BP2S with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
Currently, RISK MFI Platform works on an Agile@Scale step-up as part of the Market, Counterparty and Liquidity Cluster (‚ÄúMCL Cluster‚Äù). The RISK MFI Digital chapter (team) is composed by a group of data analysts that support the monitoring of the risks above mentioned and are part of the MCL Cluster tribes
The Digital chapter develops tools and industrialise many processes of the RISK MFI department. Projects have a strong focus on the use of new technologies to build tools that improve the risk management of the bank, with a strong focus on improving the user experience and making better use of the vast amount of available data. Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs
The Digital chapter works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best practices are followed and to target a smooth path to production of the tools developed by the team. This also means that for some projects, the Digital chapter codes directly in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The foremost element of the role is to drive development projects, related to risk management, to completion
The role requires a dynamic problem-solving approach to achieve real added value by improving the efficiency and robustness of existing processes and improving the risk monitoring. This is achieved in close collaboration with the risk management subject matter experts. As such, the role requires close coordination and collaboration with other RISK MFI teams and squads. As the main target of the team is to focus on building robust tools, a close collaboration with the RISK IT department is key

Your Main Activities Are


Analyse, re-engineer processes and implement in Python to harmonise such processes, improve efficiency, and reduce operational risk related to existing practices
Improve risk insight by making better use of data and improved visualisations
Focus on the path to production of the tools delivered by the team, making sure best practices are followed when developing tools, to simplify migration to a full industrial setup at a later stage
In addition to developing coding skills, the role enables the individual to gain knowledge across all elements of RISK MFI, covering market and/or counterparty risk. This includes all asset classes as well as all workflows and processes. Understanding the risk processes is key to delivering the best outcome of a project
Stakeholder and relationship building skills are necessary to ensure the individual can leverage the best outcomes for each project. In addition, project management skills are required to drive the various projects to completion

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Finance / Mathematics / Sciences / Economics / Econometrics / Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Programming language with a focos on Data Analytics (dictionaries / list / packages ‚Äì NumPy, Pandas)
Attention to detail / rigor
Active listening
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


]]>

BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

    • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
    • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
    • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
    • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

    BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

    • Commitment towards work/life balance

    At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

    • Remote Working Conditions

    At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

    To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

    • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
    • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Energy Data Analyst
HTML:
The Networks Platform‚Äôs Market Operations Department, that has the mission to ensure the management of production processes consumer switching and messaging and production within the scope of E-REDES, promoting operational interaction with other market agents aiming to harmonize the procedures of consumption and production and ensure the equity of treatment to all traders and intends to recruit an Energy Data Analyst.


Our company is part of EDP, a global energy group present in around 30 markets with a particular emphasis on renewable energies. With more than 45 years of experience, we have been consolidating a relevant presence on the world energy scene based on the commitment to be all-green by 2030, leading the energy transition. With more than 13,000 employees around the world, we are committed to using our energy and heart to drive a better tomorrow.


What you will do:

  • Execute tasks associated with the validation and provisioning of energy data;
  • Monitor the validation and provisioning processes for energy data;
  • Analyze exceptions and anomalous patterns in energy data, as well as categorize identified scenarios;
  • Identify enhancements for existing processes and procedures;
  • Specify business requirements and perform acceptance testing associated with energy data management system developments;
  • Definition of improvements in procedures and monitoring of the quality of work carried out by operational teams;
  • Representation in legal proceedings.

Employment type: Full-Time

Work site: Hybrid Model

Work Location: Oporto or Lisbon


What are we looking for:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in engineering or mathematics;
  • Up to 4 years' professional experience in similar functions;
  • Mandatory knowledge of energy and/or the electrical sector;
  • Strong critical thinking skills in data analysis and a proactive approach to problem-solving;
  • Proficiency in Portuguese, English, and MS Office;
  • Attention to detail, process-oriented, results-driven, proactive, and the ability to perform under pressure are critical competencies for this role.

More than academic knowledge and technical skills, we are looking for ambitious people who are enthusiastic about the future and who bring human skills aligned with our purpose.


Equal opportunities for all

Our vision is that each person combines their unique characteristics and experiences to fulfill our mission of creating new energy for the planet. We are an inclusive employer, ensuring all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to fostering a sense of belonging for each person who is part of the EDP group.


Need more reasons to apply?

As a top employer we:

  • Empower our employees through a positive and innovative work environment that promotes collaboration and agile decision-making;
  • Respect and value each person, providing a flexible, healthy, and inclusive workplace with a range of attractive benefits;
  • Provide a meaningful work experience and prepare our people for future challenges through different opportunities for development and internal mobility;


Our efforts have resulted in several distinctions over time, highlighting the EDP group's strong positioning and its dedication and commitment to attracting and retaining the best talent:

  • Top employer certification by Top Employers Institute
  • Part of the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index
  • Global certification as a family-responsible company by Fundaci√≥n M√°sfam√≠lia
  • Top 100 Workplaces by Houston Chronicle


Discover our tips to enhance your performance during the recruitment process and apply until 12/09/2024 if you think you are the right fit for this opportunity.

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ECI is the leading global provider of managed services, cybersecurity, and business transformation for mid-market financial services organizations across the globe. From its unmatched range of services, ECI provides stability, security and improved business performance, freeing clients from technology concerns and enabling them to focus on running their businesses. More than 1,000 customers worldwide with over $3 trillion of assets under management put their trust in ECI.

At ECI, we believe success is driven by passion and purpose. Our passion for technology is only surpassed by our commitment to empowering our employees around the world.

The Opportunity:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the development and deployment of Power BI reports and their underlying datasets, to provide analytics to a wide range of functional teams at ECI. This person will lead projects to bring and enhance visibility into key enterprise metrics and drive action based on the resulting insights. The successful candidate should be skilled at asking probing questions for clarity and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiences. This role requires advanced proficiency working with complex SQL queries.

The ideal candidate is a motivated, detail-oriented individual who is equally comfortable with back-end data structures, visualization, and storytelling.

This is an Onsite role.

What you will do:


Reporting: Create PowerBI reports and dashboards that provide insights to stakeholders
Data Modeling: Design and develop data models that support business requirements
Data Vizualization: Create visualizations that help stakeholders understand complex data insights
Deployment: Oversee the QA and deployment of reporting made available for consumption; Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing, conducting demos, participating in stakeholder reviews, as well as assuming the role of post-release Subject Matter Expert
Data Integrity: Communicate frequently when reports are under maintenance
Requirement Gathering: Responsible for working with other groups to efficiently define requirements and support their business objectives; these requirements will be used for tasks assigned to this role and tasks assigned to data analysts
User Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to analyze and isolate root cause of data issues and drive data cleansing efforts
Documentation: Maintain SharePoint knowledge base documentation related to solution requirements, data flow diagrams, business glossary and data lineage


Who you are:


Should have 4+ years of relevant experience.
Education/Experience: College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information science, management information systems, or business administration or a related field or equal years of experience
Data Analysis: Proven track record of analyzing large datasets and extracting meaningful insights from them
Statistics and Databases: Firm understanding of statistics and databases to be able work with data effectively
Problem Solving: Ability to identify problems and develop solutions that can help the org achieve its goals
Communication: Strong communication skills to be able to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and collaborate with other departments to achieve common goals
Change Management: experience creating reports in a sandbox before pushing to Production
Dedicated to innovation of existing operational processes
Ability to effectively prioritize and negotiate tradeoffs with stakeholders
Proficiency with ETL methodologies & syncing data across disparate systems
4+ years related experience and building analytic solutions
4+ years working with SQL and databases
Experience navigating large datasets
Exceptional at finding trends in data
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics to help differentiate between correlation and causation


Bonus points if you have:


Working Python experience, a plus


ECI‚Äôs culture is all about connection - connection with our clients, our technology and most importantly with each other. In addition to working with an amazing team around the world, ECI offers a competitive compensation package and so much more! If you believe you‚Äôd be a great fit and are ready for your best job ever, we‚Äôd like to hear from you!

Love Your Job, Share Your Technology Passion, Create Your Future Here!


Show more
